Dear all, 

I also have a question about the warc format.
I'd like to kno=
w which tool I have to use to be able to display the crawled page offline. =
I've read about NutchWAX but it seems it cannot deal with warc format for t=
he moment. 
Tks for your help
jerome 

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.c=
om, "Bernd" <bernd.fehling@...> wrote:
>
> Dear All,
> 
> while writing an =
connector for Heritrix --> SOLR I got confused
> by "Content-Type" of "Arch=
iveRecordHeader" between ARC and WARC format.
> 
> With ARC format the Cont=
ent-Type of ArchiveRecordHeader describes the 
> content of the record, the=
 "payload".
> 
> With WARC format the Content-Type of ArchiveRecordHeader d=
escribes its 
> own header. Luckily extended by "msgtype". Nevertheless the=
 
> ArchiveRecordHeader says nothing about its "payload" and if only feedin=
g
> say "text/html" I have to also analyze the content of the record.
> 
> =
1) why this change?
> 
> 2) why not naming the "Content-Type" of the header=
 "WARC-Content-Type"
>    and also for "WARC-Content-Length"?
> 
> 3) while=
 having a "WARC-Payload-Digest", why not having a "WARC-Payload-Content-Typ=
e"?
> 
> Best regards
> Bernd
>
